title: S. Gregory Boyd
text:
S. Gregory Boyd (Greg Boyd) is an American author, attorney, and professor specializing in intellectual property, the game industry, and high technology media. He is currently a partner and the chairman of the Interactive Entertainment Group at Frankfurt Kurnit Klein & Selz PC and an adjunct professor for the <a href="New%20York%20Law%20School">New York Law School</a>. He also sits on the Board of Advisors for <a href="MobyGames">MobyGames</a>.
Mr. Boyd is co-author (with Sean. F. Kane and Brian Pyne) of Video Game Law: Everything You Need To Know About Legal and Business Issues in the Game Industry (Taylor & Francis/CRC Press, Fall 2018), his second book-length discussion of the industry. He is also co-editor and co-author (with game developer Brian Green) of "Business & Legal Primer for Game Development" (2007). 
Education.
Boyd received his B.S. in Biochemistry/Philosophy and M.S. in Molecular Biology/Biotechnology from <a href="East%20Carolina%20University">East Carolina University</a>, and both his M.D. and J.D. from the schools of <a href="University%20of%20North%20Carolina%20School%20of%20Medicine">medicine</a> and <a href="University%20of%20North%20Carolina%20School%20of%20Law">law</a> at the <a href="University%20of%20North%20Carolina%20at%20Chapel%20Hill">University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill</a>. He has also graduated from the <a href="New%20York%20University%20Stern%20School%20of%20Business">NYU Stern</a> MBA program.
Professional life.
Boyd is the author of several academic and industry-specific publications on subjects ranging from money laundering in virtual currencies to organ donation. He was also an editor for the <a href="International%20Game%20Developers%20Association">International Game Developer's Association's</a> first industry publication on intellectual property.
He has been interviewed on business and legal topics by publications including <a href="Fortune%20%28magazine%29">Fortune</a>, <a href="Forbes">Forbes</a>, and IP Law and Business. He has spoken at legal and business conferences including the <a href="American%20Intellectual%20Property%20Law%20Association">American Intellectual Property Law Association</a>, Licensing Executives Society, Game Developers Conference, Austin Game Conference, and <a href="State%20of%20Play%20%28conference%20series%29">State of Play</a>. He has also been an invited speaker on business and intellectual property matters at <a href="Harvard%20Business%20School">Harvard Business School</a>, <a href="MIT">MIT</a>, <a href="Columbia%20Law%20School">Columbia Law School</a>, and other institutions.
